Author: dingles#0920
Content: The other issue is that it leaks a little bit of data that would make that specific unlock hash more susceptible to a quantum attack.

Author: dingles#0920
Content: And it is seemingly a simple ui issue. Granted there may be underlying issues as to why Komodo did this. If so, that should be explained in the ui

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: all those addresses, if it generated new one's each time, would be based on the same seed, just a different derivation path. Even a Hardware wallet (like Ledger, or Trezor) does this. It's all the same seed.

Author: dingles#0920
Content: @Regnar Yes, that is the proper way to do it

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: No. What I'm saying is there is no security benefit to doing that.

Author: kmdkrazy#8280
Content: Arrrr

Author: kmdkrazy#8280
Content: Shielded transactions coming soon to a DEX near you

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Making multiple addresses with the same seed but different derivation path does nothing for security.
